intro: Litsea yaoshanensis, commonly known as the Yaoshan litsea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Guangxi and Guizhou provinces. The plant is characterized by its aromatic evergreen leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are small drupes, typically containing a single seed, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
